status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
sarutak opened a new pull request #3212: ARROW-4065: [C++] arrowTargets.cmake is broken
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3212
 
 
   When we build Arrow's cpp library using CMake, arrowTargets.cmake will be generated and installed but it's broken.
   
   The following is a part of arrowTargets.cmake generated.
   
   ```
   # Create imported target arrow_shared
   add_library(arrow_shared SHARED IMPORTED)
   
   set_target_properties(arrow_shared PROPERTIES
     INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES "dl;pthreadshared"
   )
   
   # Create imported target arrow_static
   add_library(arrow_static STATIC IMPORTED)
   
   set_target_properties(arrow_static PROPERTIES
     INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES "glog_static;zstd_static;zlib_shared;snappy_static;lz4_static;brotli_dec_static;brotli_enc_static;brotli_common_static;double-conversion_static;boost_system_shared;boost_filesystem_shared;boost_regex_shared;jemalloc_static;rt;pthreadshared"
   )
   ```
   
   There are no INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES and linker doesn't recognize pthreadshared because the true name of pthread lib should be libpthread.so or libpthread.a.
   *_static and *_shared are also wrong name.
   
   After this fix, we can build apps which links to arrow using CMake with CMakeLists.txt like as follows.
   
   ```
   cmake_minimum_required(VERSION ...)
   project(...)
   ...
   find_package(arrow)
   add_executable(your_excellent_app ...)
   target_link_libraries(your_excellent_app arrow_shared) # or arrow_static
   ...
   ```
   
   `$ cmake -D CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/path/to/arrow /path/to/CMakeLists.txt`
   
   By the way, I noticed there lot's of CMake coding style mixed in some CMakeLists.txt.
   I modified I noticed in this PR.
   Especially, I removed white spaces from `if (` (white space is between `if` and `(`) but if `if (` is prefered, I'll put a white space between `if` and `(`.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #3212: ARROW-4065: [C++] arrowTargets.cmake is broken
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3212#discussion_r242501258
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -32,7 +32,7 @@ project(arrow VERSION "${ARROW_BASE_VERSION}")
 set(ARROW_VERSION_MAJOR "${arrow_VERSION_MAJOR}")
 set(ARROW_VERSION_MINOR "${arrow_VERSION_MINOR}")
 set(ARROW_VERSION_PATCH "${arrow_VERSION_PATCH}")
-if (ARROW_VERSION_MAJOR STREQUAL "" OR
+if(ARROW_VERSION_MAJOR STREQUAL "" OR
 
 Review comment:
   I'm not fond of the style changes here. If we want to reformat the cmake files we should do so consistently in a separate PR, IMHO. Here it's making it more tedious to follow your changes.
   
   (also it seems there are automatic tools for that, such as https://github.com/cheshirekow/cmake_format)

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #3212: ARROW-4065: [C++] arrowTargets.cmake is broken
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3212#discussion_r242501691
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/BuildUtils.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -24,62 +24,29 @@ function(ADD_THIRDPARTY_LIB LIB_NAME)
     message(SEND_ERROR "Error: unrecognized arguments: ${ARG_UNPARSED_ARGUMENTS}")
   endif()
 
-  if(ARG_STATIC_LIB AND ARG_SHARED_LIB)
-    if(NOT ARG_STATIC_LIB)
-      message(FATAL_ERROR "No static or shared library provided for ${LIB_NAME}")
-    endif()
-
-    SET(AUG_LIB_NAME "${LIB_NAME}_static")
-    add_library(${AUG_LIB_NAME} STATIC IMPORTED)
-    set_target_properties(${AUG_LIB_NAME}
+  if(ARG_STATIC_LIB)
+    add_library(${LIB_NAME} STATIC IMPORTED)
+    set_target_properties(${LIB_NAME}
       PROPERTIES IMPORTED_LOCATION "${ARG_STATIC_LIB}")
     if(ARG_DEPS)
-      set_target_properties(${AUG_LIB_NAME}
+      set_target_properties(${LIB_NAME}
         PROPERTIES INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES "${ARG_DEPS}")
     endif()
-    message("Added static library dependency ${AUG_LIB_NAME}: ${ARG_STATIC_LIB}")
 
 Review comment:
   I don't understand why you removed all this.

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #3212: ARROW-4065: [C++] arrowTargets.cmake is broken
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3212#discussion_r242502694
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -366,10 +360,10 @@ if (ARROW_BOOST_VENDORED)
     "${BOOST_LIB_DIR}/${CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_PREFIX}boost_filesystem${CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}")
   set(BOOST_STATIC_REGEX_LIBRARY
     "${BOOST_LIB_DIR}/${CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_PREFIX}boost_regex${CMAKE_STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}")
-  set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY boost_system_static)
-  set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY boost_filesystem_static)
-  set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY boost_regex_static)
-  if (ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
+  set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY boost_system)
 
 Review comment:
   Can you explain why you're removing the "static" and "shared" prefixes everywhere? We're explicitly selecting one or the other variant of a library (for example, here we're linking statically with boost, while later below we're linking dynamically with it).

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

sarutak commented on issue #3212: ARROW-4065: [C++] arrowTargets.cmake is broken
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3212#issuecomment-451732556
 
 
   @pitrou  <LIBNAME>Targets.cmake (or *-targets.cmake) is referred by CMake when applications which links to a library named <LIBNAME> is built by cmake command.
   
   Arrow also provides arrowTargets.cmake so this means CMake user expect they can  build applications linking to Arrow like as follows.
   
   ```
   $ cmake -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/path/to/arrow /path/to/target-application
   ```
   
   But there are two problems.
   First, there are no `INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES` properties settings in `set_target_properties` command in arrowTargets.cmake.
   Due to this issue, CMake can't find `include` directory for Arrow during target application compilation time.
   arrowTargets.cmake is generated by CMake when we build Arrow. So to add `INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES` properties, we need to tell where the include directory is by adding `INCLUDES DESTINATION` property to `install` command in `BuildUtils.cmake`.
   
   The second problem is the library names following `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` property in `set_target_properties` command are broken.
   They are like `zlib_shared` or `pthreadshared`. They are  just target names, not library names.
   Due to this issue, linking will fail during the target application is built. They should be like `z` and `pthread (or -lpthread)`.
   `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` property and values are also generated automatically so the simplest way to set library names to `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` without the suffixes (like `_shared or _static`, set target library names to their library names in `target_link_libraries`.
   But unlike most C++ libraries, Arrow needs to do `target_link_library` for both static and shared libraries in `ADD_THIRDPARTY_LIB` in `BuildUtils.cmake` (so** I understand my first solution is rejected).
   Another solution is modifying `target_link_libraries` command for `libarrow` (not other libraries linked by Arrow).
   By adding "$<BUILD_INTERFACE:${ARG_SHARED_LINK_LIBS}>", `"$<BUILD_INTERFACE:${ARG_STATIC_LINK_LIBS}>"` and `"$<INSTALL_INTERFACE:${INTERFACE_LIBS}>"` to the `target_link_libraries` command, we can refer the dependent library names as `*_static` or `_shared` while we can add suffix-less names to `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` in arrowTargets.cmake to be generated.
   The new variables added are for this.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

   Arrow also provides arrowTargets.cmake so this means CMake user expect they can  build applications linking to Arrow like as follows.

   But there are two problems.
   First, there are no `INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES` properties settings in `set_target_properties` command in arrowTargets.cmake.
   Due to this issue, CMake can't find `include` directory for Arrow during target application compilation time.
   arrowTargets.cmake is generated by CMake when we build Arrow. So to add `INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES` properties, we need to tell where the include directory is by adding `INCLUDES DESTINATION` property to `install` command in `BuildUtils.cmake`.
   
   The second problem is the library names following `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` property in `set_target_properties` command are broken.
   They are like `zlib_shared` or `pthreadshared`. They are  just target names, not library names.
   Due to this issue, linking will fail during the target application is built. They should be like `z` and `pthread (or -lpthread)`.
   `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` property and values are also generated automatically so the simplest way to set library names to `INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES` without the suffixes (like `_shared or _static`, set target library names to their library names in `target_link_libraries`.
   But unlike most C++ libraries, Arrow needs to do `target_link_library` for both static and shared libraries in `ADD_THIRDPARTY_LIB` in `BuildUtils.cmake` (so** I understand my first solution is rejected).
   Another solution is modifying `target_link_libraries` command for `libarrow` (not other libraries linked by Arrow).

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When we build Arrow's cpp library using CMake, arrowTargets.cmake will be generated and installed but it's broken.

The following is a part of arrowTargets.cmake generated.

{code}
# Create imported target arrow_shared
add_library(arrow_shared SHARED IMPORTED)

set_target_properties(arrow_shared PROPERTIES
  INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES "dl;pthreadshared"
)

# Create imported target arrow_static
add_library(arrow_static STATIC IMPORTED)

set_target_properties(arrow_static PROPERTIES
  INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES "glog_static;zstd_static;zlib_shared;snappy_static;lz4_static;brotli_dec_static;brotli_enc_static;brotli_common_static;double-conversion_static;boost_system_shared;boost_filesystem_shared;boost_regex_shared;jemalloc_static;rt;pthreadshared"
)
{code}

There are no INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES and linker doesn't recognize pthreadshared because the true name of pthread should be libpthread.so or libpthread.a.
*_static and *_shared are also wrong name.

Because of this, apps which links arrow can't be built using CMake.
